questionParts: Compute the partial derivative with respect to \(x\), \(f_{x} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial x}\)
explanationParts: To find \(f_{x}\), treat \(y\) as a constant and differentiate with respect to \(x\).
The derivative of \(4x^3y\) with respect to \(x\) is \((3 \cdot 4x^2)y = 12x^2y\).
The derivative of \(-7x\) with respect to \(x\) is \(-7\).
The derivative of \(2y^6\) with respect to \(x\) is 0.

questionParts: Compute the partial derivative with respect to \(y\), \(f_{y} = \frac{\partial f}{\partial y}\)
explanationParts: To find \(f_{y}\), treat \(x\) as a constant and differentiate with respect to \(y\).
The derivative of \(4x^3y\) with respect to \(y\) is \(4x^3\).
The derivative of \(-7x\) with respect to \(y\) is 0.
The derivative of \(2y^6\) with respect to \(y\) is \(12y^5\).

questionParts: Compute the partial derivative with respect to \(x\), \(g_{x} = \frac{\partial g}{\partial x}\)
explanationParts: To find \(g_{x}\), treat \(y\) as a constant and differentiate with respect to \(x\).
The derivative of \(3x^2y^3\) with respect to \(x\) is \(6xy^3\).
The derivative of \(\cos(y)\) with respect to \(x\) is 0.

questionParts: Compute the partial derivative with respect to \(y\), \(h_{y} = \frac{\partial h}{\partial y}\)
explanationParts: To find \(h_{y}\), treat \(x\) as a constant and differentiate with respect to \(y\).
The derivative of \(5\sin(x)\) with respect to \(y\) is 0.
The derivative of \(x^4y^2\) with respect to \(y\) is \(2x^4y\).
